description: The underlying technical condition responsible for CVE-2023-36719 is a flaw in the Microsoft Speech Application Programming Interface (SAPI) that allows for elevation of privilege. This flaw enables an attacker to gain system privileges by logging onto the target system and executing a specially crafted application designed to exploit the vulnerability. The vulnerable builds include Windows 10 versions 10.0.22631.2715, 10.0.19043.3693, 10.0.10240.20308, and various builds of Windows Server 2008, 2012, and 2016. The associated KB articles are KB-5032199, KB-5032192, KB-5032190, and KB-5032189. If successfully exploited, the flaw could lead to a total loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability of resources managed by the affected component.
